text.p: Platinum Technology Inc said Tuesday it has begun marketing its SystemVision YEAR 2000 software, designed to deal with the anticipated turn-of-the century computer crisis.
Most computers use the last two digits of the year and assume 19 as the first two.
In June, Platinum signed an exclusive worldwide agreement with software developer ADPAC Corp to market the product.
For $50,000, Platinum provides an assessment of the impact the year 2000 will have on a company, and 25 percent of that can be applied to the purchase of SystemVision software, the company said.

Platinum also said Tuesday that it introduced a new data warehouse software for the insurance industry, called RiskAdvisor. The software analyzes vast amounts of insurance data and can help companies pinpoint profitable areas, for example.
Platinum said two of its other data warehousing softwares have been included in Microsoft Corp's data analysis alliance.
